result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark L. Eberling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be distributed in the following manner - $582.58 to D. Kramarczyk and $475.80 to National Government Services Inc. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with D. Kramarczyk directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark L. Eberling

records.addlTxt:
15CM400 & 15CM451 Cases called @ 2:37 p.m. Defendant Mark L. Eberling in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CM400: Ct 2 - Guilty. 15CM451: Ct 1 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CM400: Ct 1 - DRI. Statement by victim, D.K. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. 

Court orders: 90 days WC Jail on each count concurrent - Huber, GT, 1 days CFTS,  I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: NC w/ D. Kramarczyk, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Restitution in the amount of $582.58 to D.K. and $475.80 to National Government Services Inc, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. The defendant may petition for early termination after 6 months provided all programming is complete and all financial obligations are paid in full. Appeal rights given

Case called @ 1:23 p.m. Defendant Mark L. Eberling in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $1500 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:35 am.
